@graph.name: Shopify Getting Started Guide
@graph.description: Complete step-by-step guide to get started with Shopify, covering account setup, store customization, product management, and launch preparation for successful ecommerce stores.
@graph.browserRequirements: Modern web browser with JavaScript enabled

audience.audienceType: Shopify store owners, ecommerce entrepreneurs, online retailers

@graph.name: How to Get Started with Shopify
@graph.description: Complete tutorial for setting up and launching a successful Shopify store from account creation to going live.

step.name: Set Up Your Shopify Account
step.text: Sign up for Shopify, choose a pricing plan, and configure your basic settings, such as store currency and tax settings.

step.name: Choose a Domain Name
step.text: Purchase a new domain through Shopify or connect an existing domain. Set up a custom domain to enhance your brand and improve search engine optimization.

step.name: Select and Customize a Shopify Theme
step.text: Choose from free or paid Shopify themes and customize it to match your brand identity using the theme settings.

step.name: Add Products and Manage Inventory
step.text: Add products to your store, set prices, and manage inventory using Shopify's inventory management tools. Organize products into categories for better customer experience.

step.name: Set Up Payment and Shipping Options
step.text: Configure Shopify Payments, integrate additional payment gateways, and set up shipping options, including shipping rates and delivery methods.

step.name: Prepare Your Store for Launch
step.text: Test the checkout process, set up password protection, configure customer accounts, and optimize your store for search engines.

step.name: Launch and Promote Your Shopify Store
step.text: Make your store live, promote it using sales channels and marketing tools, and monitor its performance with Shopify analytics.

mainEntity.name: How do I choose the right Shopify pricing plan?

acceptedAnswer.text: Start with the basic plan for essential features. High volume businesses should consider advanced plans for additional tools and reduced transaction fees.

mainEntity.name: Should I buy a domain through Shopify or use an existing one?

acceptedAnswer.text: Buying through Shopify automatically configures it for your store. You can also connect an existing domain by updating DNS settings to point to Shopify's servers.

mainEntity.name: What's the difference between free and paid Shopify themes?

acceptedAnswer.text: Free themes are great for starting out, while paid themes offer more customization options, advanced layout features, and greater design flexibility.

mainEntity.name: How do I test my store before launching?

acceptedAnswer.text: Use Shopify's test order feature to go through the entire purchase process without charging your credit card. Enable password protection while testing.

@graph.name: Getting Started with Shopify - Complete Setup Guide
@graph.description: Learn how to get started with Shopify through our comprehensive guide covering account setup, store customization, product management, and successful launch strategies.

hasDefinedTerm.name: Shopify Payments
hasDefinedTerm.description: The default payment gateway on the Shopify platform that allows you to accept credit card payments directly without needing a third-party payment provider.

hasDefinedTerm.name: Custom Domain
hasDefinedTerm.description: A personalized web address for your store rather than using the default Shopify subdomain, important for branding and SEO.

hasDefinedTerm.name: Theme Customization
hasDefinedTerm.description: The process of modifying your Shopify theme's colors, fonts, layouts, and adding brand elements to match your business identity.

hasDefinedTerm.name: Inventory Management
hasDefinedTerm.description: Shopify's built-in system for tracking stock levels, setting up inventory alerts, and managing product availability across multiple sales channels.

@graph.name: Shopify Setup Use Cases
@graph.description: Common scenarios and applications for setting up a Shopify store

itemListElement.name: New Business Launch
itemListElement.description: Complete setup for entrepreneurs launching their first online store with Shopify's comprehensive ecommerce platform.

itemListElement.name: Existing Business Migration
itemListElement.description: Migrating from another ecommerce platform to Shopify while maintaining business continuity and customer experience.

itemListElement.name: Multi-Channel Selling
itemListElement.description: Setting up Shopify to sell across multiple channels including online store, social media, and marketplaces.

itemListElement.name: International Expansion
itemListElement.description: Configuring Shopify for global sales with proper tax settings, currency options, and shipping configurations.
